title: Xayah's and Rakan's color stories just got new picture added
body:
[Rakan - Nothing Rhymes with Tubebow](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/rakan-color-story/)
[Xayah - Puboe Prison Break](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/xayah-color-story/)

Well, it seems that both color stories got a handful new picture by an artist named Robert Kim.

replies.body: That’s awesome!  And a surpirise to me— no one told me they were doing this to our stories!
is every champion going to get this when their time comes?

I didn't even know they were putting these pictures one of my stories (Nothing Rhymes with Tubebow) so... uh...  obviously I've got no idea.   I'd love it if they did.

 Also interesting they actually credited Robert Kim's artwork... (hooray! and great job!)  but no credits for us poor writers...    (sob.)
wait how can they get away with not crediting you for your work?
Do, writers want credit for the stories? Stupid question, but we're always asking who wrote what.

Obviously...  Everybody always wants credit, or praise....  or even blame.   
(Please somebody notice me!!!)  That's why you make stuff. 
....

It's also why you drink.

I'd really like the respective writers to be listed too.

After reading Rakan's story I went I went scouring for more; same as when Jellbug's Dreamsong came out (so good <3).

Different writers have different tones and while some people may insist writers try to blend while at a studio (i.e. OG Walt Disney), I like that Riot seems to embrace it.
Wish they'd get credit like the visual artists do though.

Would also like more parity on champ releases for the DNA pod.
If there is parity throughout production the release should also demonstrate that.
i woudnt mind a few drinks over a nice little Aatrox discussion :)

As far I'm aware these are the only additions. But feel free to prove me wrong, tho.

If you like it, tell people about it, and generate clicks. Riot is looking at every single aspect of player engagement with content like this, including how long you spend on a page, how far you scroll down it, and how many times you come back...

And if you want to see illustrations in other existing stories, please do request it! :-)

If I understand correctly, this only works for the client hyperlink?
If it work for the whole Universe website, I think Riot should be worried how often I use the site...
I don’t see the harm in backtracking, or doing so for future stories.

I like how, near the end of their stories, when one of their Vastaya died, you can see Xayah with everyone and Rakan off in a tree.  In Xayah's story, she looks sad as if she failed somehow, and it looks as though Rakan is aloof as ever in his own world like always.

Then, when you see Rakan's POV of the art, he's actually in the tree, mourning. He's trying to hold back tears cause the death of that guard wasn't necesary, and they failed in getting everyone out alive.  Rakan is away, not because he's aloof, but to hide his grief.  That, right there, is beautiful.
That's super cool!

Hope they continue these for more then Just those two and don't end it right away.... honestly I feel like that is a recurring theme with a lot of the 
lore stuff .__.
